dfischer.utils

Class SymmetricEncryptContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.SymmetricEncryptContext

  • public class SymmetricEncryptContext
extends java.lang.Object
    The serializable context of a symmetric encryption containing the name of the algorithm, the symmetric key and the IV.
    Since:
    V5.4-J
    See Also:
    SymmetricEncrypt, writeObject(DataOutputStream), readObject(DataInputStream)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SymmetricEncryptContext()
      Create an empty instance - used of object transfer only.
      SymmetricEncryptContext(java.lang.String encryptionAlgorithm, iaik.security.cipher.SecretKey secretKey, javax.crypto.Cipher cipher, byte[] cipherIV)
      Create a full initialized instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SymmetricEncryptContext

        public SymmetricEncryptContext()
        Create an empty instance - used of object transfer only.

      • SymmetricEncryptContext

        public SymmetricEncryptContext(java.lang.String encryptionAlgorithm,
                       iaik.security.cipher.SecretKey secretKey,
                       javax.crypto.Cipher cipher,
                       byte[] cipherIV)
        Create a full initialized instance.
        Parameters:
        encryptionAlgorithm - the symmetric encryption algorithm. Examples: AES, Twofish
        secretKey - the symmetric key
        cipher - the cipher (will not be serialized)
        cipherIV - the IV of the cipher

    • Method Detail

      • getEncryptionAlgorithm

        public java.lang.String getEncryptionAlgorithm()
        Get the symmetric encryption algorithm.
        Returns:
        the symmetric encryption algorithm

        Get the symmetric key.
        Returns:
        the symmetric key

      • getCipher

        public javax.crypto.Cipher getCipher()
        Get the cipher. Note that getting the cipher is used for encryption only and that the cipher is not serialized.
        Returns:
        the cipher, or null if no such data are available.

      • getCipherIV

        public byte[] getCipherIV()
        Get the IV of the cipher.
        Returns:
        the IV of the cipher

        Dump the data of the instance to stdout - for debug purposes only.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an initialized instance.
